instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on, usb test light flashing on and off rapidly
threads.message:
Board originally had corrosion damage and not powering up. After cleaning, replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR>. Also repaired trace between <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR>(1) and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>(8). It worked for about a week and now not powering up again. When i place heat using a soldering iron directly on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for about a minute, i can then boot up the board. When allowed to cool, the board fan spins for about 5 seconds, shuts off and then starts spin. At this point, the usb port keeps repeating on and off (usb test led goes on and off). I've replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> multiple times, along with <RESISTOR>R1962</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1963</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR>. Replaced the wire used to repair the trace between <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR>(1) and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>(8) previously as well, with the same result.

one other thing to note, when i try measuring the voltage on <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR>(2), the board shuts off. <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR>(1) is 3.3v and the board doesn't shutoff when i take measurement from that point 

Any suggestion

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on, usb test light flashing on and off rapidly
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> voltage at pins 7 & 3, when the board doesn't want to turn on.
Be sure to have good trace from pin 8 to <SIGNAL>3V_42G3H</SIGNAL>.
